title: What is the meaning of the phrase "il che va però a colpire" in relation to esotericism and morality?
first_phrase: In the previous text, the author discusses the concept of evil and how it affects our lives, even if it comes from good intentions. Now, in the last 200 tokens, the author reflects on the ancient Greek notion of the good and how it was more related to ontology than ethics. The author argues that the idea of virtue as strength and completeness, opposed to moralistic beliefs, was preserved until the Renaissance. Additionally, when it comes to initiatic asceticism, moral guidelines should be based on these views. The text presents an insightful and thought-provoking analysis of the differences between the ancient Greek and modern Western concepts of good and evil.
content: Dal che procede anche un significato della virttí (virtus) del tutto opposto a quello moralistico, significato che si conservò, del resto, fino al periodo della Rinascenza: virtú come forza, come quella completezza e virilità di forza (virtus e vir, , uomo in senso specifico, hanno la stessa ra dice) che, in via eminente, è qualità di « coloro che sono », dei Compiuti, dei Sichlba. Se l'ascesi iniziatica deve com portare una « morale », questa non saprebbe aver per pun to di riferimento che vedute del genere. Aggiungeremo la seguente considerazione. Nello svi luppo iniziatico vanno distinte due fasi.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the concept of Virtus holds a meaning far beyond just moral behavior, embodying strength and completeness. As for the initiatory asceticism, it involves two distinct phases. The first aims at achieving centralization and reconnecting with the transcendent principle within oneself. The ultimate goal is to attain a state of being where nothing is lacking or lost, and nothing can perturb the self or arouse passion.
